data.title: "Lorna Doone's" Children's Corner
data.meta_description: To-day the membership of "The Children's Corner" has reached the grand total of 2763. New members enrolled: Kathleen Wilkins (9Â½), June ...
data.text:
To.day the membership of "The

Children's Corner" has reached the

grand total of 2763. New members en

rolled: Kathleen Wilkins (9d), June

Rodman (11), Letitia Rodman (10),

Sprent; Patricia Williams (11), Upper

Burnie; Judith Brett and Gerald Brett

(121-4), twins, Gunn's Plains; Pam

Saltmarsh (102), N. Motton.

The monthly prize (6-11 years), goes

to Ila Willcox (9),' Gawler, for "Mus

tard and Cress," a quaint little piece

hoe copied, highly commended on Oc

tober 0, and published to-day. To sow

very carefully the seeds of tiny plants

such as mustard and cress, or better

still, those of gay and low growing

flowers. to spell a name later on, is an

old anl very charming custom. Try

it in your own garden! Make the soil

very fine, mark the name with a stick,

then scatter the seed of "mustard and

cress," Virginia stock or lobelia.

"'Elizabeth," the name of the little

girl in the winning verses, is rather

long, so try "Ann," "Beth." "Jim"

or ' Bill" to begin with! The weekly

prize (6.16 years) has been awarded for

"To the Lark," verses copied by Eric

Cooper (8}), "Mawbanna). The E]ng

lish skylark with its lilting note is

heard quite often now. It is a joy to

listen to the little bird, singing in the

sunshine as it wings its way to the

blue skies. It trills all the way back

to the ground below, too.

Two entries of copied verses, "She's

England Yet" from June Rodman (11)

Sprent, ndal "Gate of the Year" from

Letitia Rodman (10), Sprent, two new

comers to "The Corner," are highly

commended today. These highly com

mended entries, as well as those held

over from previous weeks, will be pub

lished as space permits.

Once more I have to remind members

that requests for pen-friends should

not be made in their letters, also that

entries should he written in ink, not

in pencil. Address all correspondence

to "Lorna Doone," "The Advocate"

Office, Ulverstone (not to Burnie or

Devonport). Love to all girls and

boys of "The Corner" . . . LORNA

DOONE.
